title: Overview
description: A high-level introduction to the AIGNE Framework, explaining what it is, the problems it solves, and how its components (Core, CLI, Models) work together.

title: Core Framework
description: Dive into the fundamental components of the AIGNE Core, including the main AIGNE engine, context management, and different agent types.

title: AIGNE & Context
description: Understand the main AIGNE class that orchestrates agents and the Context object that manages state and observability.

title: Agents
description: Explore the different types of agents available in the AIGNE framework, which are the fundamental actors for performing tasks.

title: Command Line Interface (CLI)
description: A complete guide to the AIGNE Command Line Interface (CLI), your command center for creating, running, and managing AI agents.

title: Overview
description: Start here to understand what the AIGNE Command Line Tool is, what problems it solves, and what you can do with it. This section will give you a quick tour of its main features.

title: Getting Started
description: A step-by-step guide to get you from installation to running your first AI agent in just a few minutes.

title: Installation
description: Follow these simple steps to install the AIGNE Command Line Tool on your computer so you can start creating and using AI agents.

title: Creating a Project
description: Learn how to create a new project, which acts as a container for your AI agent's settings and skills, using a simple command.

title: Running an Agent
description: Start a conversation with your newly created AI agent to test it out and see how it responds in an interactive chat.

title: Command Reference
description: A quick reference guide to the most common commands you'll use to create, run, and manage your AI agents.

title: create
description: Use the `create` command to start a new AIGNE project, which sets up all the necessary files and folders for you.

title: run
description: Use the `run` command to start a chat session or send a single message to your agent to see it in action.

title: test
description: Use the `test` command to automatically run checks that ensure your agent's skills and configurations are working correctly.

title: serve-mcp
description: Use the `serve-mcp` command to make your agent available as a service that other applications can connect to and interact with.

title: observe
description: Use the `observe` command to start a local web server that lets you visually monitor and debug your agent's activities.

title: deploy
description: Use the `deploy` command to package and publish your agent application to a specified endpoint.

title: hub
description: Use the `hub` command to connect to and manage your AIGNE Hub account, giving you access to more models and features.

title: AI Models
description: Explore the wide range of supported AI models you can use with the AIGNE Framework, from providers like OpenAI, Anthropic, Google, and more.

title: AIGNE Hub
description: Connect to the AIGNE Hub to access a unified proxy for multiple LLM providers, manage credits, and simplify API key management.

title: Anthropic (Claude)
description: Leverage Anthropic's Claude models, known for their strong performance in complex reasoning and creative tasks.

title: AWS Bedrock
description: Access a variety of foundation models from leading AI companies through Amazon's fully managed AWS Bedrock service.

title: DeepSeek
description: Integrate DeepSeek's powerful open-source language models into your agents for strong coding and reasoning capabilities.

title: Doubao
description: Connect with Doubao's AI models for a wide range of language and image generation tasks.

title: Google Gemini
description: Use Google's Gemini family of multimodal models for tasks involving text, images, and more.

title: Ideogram
description: Generate high-quality images from text prompts using Ideogram's advanced image synthesis models.

title: LM Studio
description: Run local language models on your own machine through LM Studio's OpenAI-compatible server.

title: Ollama
description: Utilize a wide variety of open-source models running locally on your machine via the Ollama server.

title: OpenAI
description: Integrate OpenAI's powerful GPT models, including chat completions and DALL-E image generation, into your AIGNE agents.

title: OpenRouter
description: Access a diverse marketplace of models from multiple providers through a single, unified OpenRouter API.

title: Poe
description: Integrate with various AI models available on the Poe platform through its OpenAI-compatible API.

title: xAI (Grok)
description: Connect to xAI's models, like Grok, known for their unique personality and real-time information access.

title: AI Agent
description: Learn about the `AIAgent`, the core component for executing AI tasks, processing instructions, and interacting with large language models.

title: Function Agent
description: Learn about the `FunctionAgent`, which executes specific, predefined functions or tools based on user input.

title: Team Agent
description: Discover the `TeamAgent`, a powerful component that orchestrates multiple agents to collaborate on complex tasks.

title: MCP Agent
description: Understand the `MCPAgent`, which exposes agent functionality over the Model Context Protocol (MCP) for interoperability.
